verses.verse: Call <S%H7121><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> if there be any that will answer <S%H6030><s%> you; and to which <S%H4310><s%> of the saints <S%H6918><s%> will you turn? <S%H6437><s%>
For wrath <S%H3708><s%> kills <S%H2026><s%> the foolish <S%H191><s%> man, and envy <S%H7068><s%> slays <S%H4191><s%> the silly <S%H6601><s%> one.
I have seen <S%H7200><s%> the foolish <S%H191><s%> taking root: <S%H8327><s%> but suddenly <S%H6597><s%> I cursed <S%H5344><s%> his habitation. <S%H5116><s%>

His children <S%H1121><s%> are far <S%H7350><s%> from safety, <S%H3468><s%> and they are crushed <S%H1792><s%> in the gate, <S%H8179><s%> neither <S%H369><s%> is there any to deliver <S%H5337><s%> them.

Whose <S%H834><s%> harvest <S%H7105><s%> the hungry <S%H7456><s%> eats <S%H398><s%> up, and takes <S%H3947><s%> it even out of the thorns, <S%H6791><s%> and the robber <S%H6782><s%> swallows <S%H7602><s%> up their substance. <S%H2428><s%>

Although <S%H3588><s%> affliction <S%H205><s%> comes <S%H3318><s%> not forth <S%H3318><s%> of the dust, <S%H6083><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> does trouble <S%H5999><s%> spring <S%H6779><s%> out of the ground; <S%H127><s%>
Yet <S%H3588><s%> man <S%H120><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> to trouble, <S%H5999><s%> as the sparks <S%H1121><s%> <S%H7565><s%> fly <S%H5774><s%> upward. <S%H1361><s%>
I would seek <S%H1875><s%> to God, <S%H410><s%> and to God <S%H430><s%> would I commit <S%H7760><s%> my cause: <S%H1700><s%>
Which does <S%H6213><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> things and unsearchable; <S%H369><s%> <S%H2714><s%> marvelous <S%H6381><s%> things without <S%H5704><s%> <S%H369><s%> number: <S%H4557><s%>
Who gives <S%H5414><s%> rain <S%H4306><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> and sends <S%H7971><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> on the fields: <S%H2351><s%>
To set <S%H7760><s%> up on high <S%H4791><s%> those that be low; <S%H8217><s%> that those which mourn <S%H6937><s%> may be exalted <S%H7682><s%> to safety. <S%H3468><s%>
He disappoints <S%H6565><s%> the devices <S%H4284><s%> of the crafty, <S%H6175><s%> so that their hands <S%H3027><s%> cannot <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> perform their enterprise. <S%H8454><s%>
He takes <S%H3920><s%> the wise <S%H2450><s%> in their own craftiness: <S%H6193><s%> and the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the fraudulent <S%H6617><s%> is carried <S%H4116><s%> headlong.
They meet <S%H6298><s%> with darkness <S%H2822><s%> in the day time, <S%H3119><s%> and grope <S%H4959><s%> in the noonday <S%H6672><s%> as in the night. <S%H3915><s%>
But he saves <S%H3467><s%> the poor <S%H34><s%> from the sword, <S%H2719><s%> from their mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the mighty. <S%H2389><s%>
So the poor <S%H1800><s%> has <S%H1961><s%> hope, <S%H8615><s%> and iniquity <S%H5766><s%> stops <S%H7092><s%> her mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> happy <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H582><s%> whom God <S%H433><s%> corrects: <S%H3198><s%> therefore despise <S%H3988><s%> not you the chastening <S%H4148><s%> of the Almighty: <S%H7706><s%>
For he makes sore, <S%H3510><s%> and binds <S%H2280><s%> up: he wounds, <S%H4272><s%> and his hands <S%H3027><s%> make whole. <S%H7495><s%>
He shall deliver <S%H5337><s%> you in six <S%H8337><s%> troubles: <S%H6869><s%> yes, in seven <S%H7651><s%> there shall no <S%H3808><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> touch <S%H5060><s%> you.
In famine <S%H7458><s%> he shall redeem <S%H6299><s%> you from death: <S%H4194><s%> and in war <S%H4421><s%> from the power <S%H3027><s%> of the sword. <S%H2719><s%>

You shall be hid <S%H2244><s%> from the whip <S%H7752><s%> of the tongue: <S%H3956><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall you be afraid <S%H3372><s%> of destruction <S%H7701><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it comes. <S%H935><s%>
At destruction <S%H7701><s%> and famine <S%H3720><s%> you shall laugh: <S%H7832><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> shall you be afraid <S%H3372><s%> of the beasts <S%H2416><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
For you shall be in league <S%H1285><s%> with the stones <S%H68><s%> of the field: <S%H7704><s%> and the beasts <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> shall be at peace <S%H7999><s%> with you.
And you shall know <S%H3045><s%> that your tabernacle <S%H168><s%> shall be in peace; <S%H7965><s%> and you shall visit <S%H6485><s%> your habitation, <S%H5116><s%> and shall not sin. <S%H2398><s%>
You shall know <S%H3045><s%> also that your seed <S%H2233><s%> shall be great, <S%H7227><s%> and your offspring <S%H6631><s%> as the grass <S%H6212><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
You shall come <S%H935><s%> to your grave <S%H6913><s%> in a full <S%H3624><s%> age, <S%H3624><s%> like as a shock <S%H1430><s%> of corn comes <S%H5927><s%> in in his season. <S%H6256><s%>
See <S%H2009><s%> this, <S%H2063><s%> we have searched <S%H2713><s%> it, so <S%H3651><s%> it is; hear <S%H8085><s%> it, and know <S%H3045><s%> you it for your good. <S%H2896><s%>
